snippet: Seeking to project strength, banks sometimes shift risk without actually moving assets. | Lawmakers could be stymied in efforts to rein in banking consultants. | A KPMG executive who was fired by the firm leaked secret information to a friend on the...
abstract: Seeking to project strength, banks sometimes shift risk without actually moving assets. | Lawmakers could be stymied in efforts to rein in banking consultants. | A KPMG executive who was fired by the firm leaked secret information to a friend on the golf course. | The Federal Reserve’s meeting minutes March were released early to banks by mistake.

headline.main: Now You See the Risk, Now You Don't
